abstract: Cubans react warmly to arrival of Pope Francis, first Latino pope, while harboring both doubts and hopes with regards to whether visit will have any lasting impact; many believe Francis will press for more church freedom and continue his call for greater economic equality, but wonder how Cuba’s restrictive government will react.
lead_paragraph: As Pope Francis arrives for a four-day stay in Cuba, residents wonder if he will speak publicly about political freedom and what change, if any, his visit will bring to the nation.

headline.main: Cubans Have Mixed Opinions on Effect of Visit by Pope Francis
headline.print_headline: Excitement in Havana Is Tinged With Doubts About Visit’s Effect

snippet: As Pope Francis arrives for a four-day stay in Cuba, residents wonder if he will speak publicly about political freedom and what change, if any, his visit will bring to the nation.
